```diff
+ #!/usr/bin/env python3
+ """
+ Laravel Learning Video Downloader & Transcriber
+ Downloads videos from the Laravel course playlist and transcribes them
+ """
+ 
+ import os
+ import subprocess
+ import json
+ from pathlib import Path
+ import requests
+ import whisper
+ from youtube_dl import YoutubeDL
+ 
+ # Course playlist URL
+ PLAYLIST_URL = "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1NjOWtQ7S2o&list=PL3VM-unCzF8hy47mt9-chowaHNjfkuEVz"
+ OUTPUT_DIR = Path("./videos")
+ TRANSCRIPTS_DIR = Path("./transcripts")
+ 
+ def setup_directories():
+     """Create necessary directories"""
+     OUTPUT_DIR.mkdir(exist_ok=True)
+     TRANSCRIPTS_DIR.mkdir(exist_ok=True)
+     print(f"ğŸ“ Created directories: {OUTPUT_DIR} and {TRANSCRIPTS_DIR}")
+ 
+ def download_playlist():
+     """Download the entire playlist"""
+     ydl_opts = {
+         'format': 'best[height<=720]',  # Download 720p max to save space
+         'outtmpl': str(OUTPUT_DIR / '%(playlist_index)02d-%(title)s.%(ext)s'),
+         'writeinfojson': True,  # Save metadata
+         'writesubtitles': True,  # Download captions if available
+         'writeautomaticsub': True,  # Download auto-generated captions
+     }
+     
+     with YoutubeDL(ydl_opts) as ydl:
+         print(f"ğŸ¬ Downloading playlist: {PLAYLIST_URL}")
+         ydl.download([PLAYLIST_URL])
+ 
+ def transcribe_videos():
+     """Transcribe all downloaded videos"""
+     model = whisper.load_model("base")  # Load Whisper model
+     
+     video_files = list(OUTPUT_DIR.glob("*.mp4")) + list(OUTPUT_DIR.glob("*.webm"))
+     
+     for video_file in video_files:
+         transcript_file = TRANSCRIPTS_DIR / f"{video_file.stem}.txt"
+         
+         if transcript_file.exists():
+             print(f"â­ï¸  Skipping {video_file.name} (already transcribed)")
+             continue
+             
+         print(f"ğŸ™ï¸  Transcribing {video_file.name}...")
+         
+         # Transcribe with Whisper
+         result = model.transcribe(str(video_file))
+         
+         # Save transcript
+         with open(transcript_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f:
+             f.write(f"# {video_file.stem}\n\n")
+             f.write(result["text"])
+         
+         print(f"âœ… Saved transcript: {transcript_file}")
+ 
+ def create_index():
+     """Create an index of all videos and transcripts"""
+     index = []
+     
+     for transcript_file in TRANSCRIPTS_DIR.glob("*.txt"):
+         with open(transcript_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f:
+             content = f.read()
+             
+         index.append({
+             "filename": transcript_file.name,
+             "title": transcript_file.stem,
+             "content_preview": content[:200] + "..." if len(content) > 200 else content
+         })
+     
+     # Save index
+     with open("video-index.json", 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f:
+         json.dump(index, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False)
+     
+     print(f"ğŸ“‹ Created index with {len(index)} videos")
+ 
+ def main():
+     print("ğŸš€ Laravel Learning Setup Starting...")
+     
+     setup_directories()
+     
+     # Check dependencies
+     try:
+         import youtube_dl
+         import whisper
+     except ImportError as e:
+         print(f"âŒ Missing dependency: {e}")
+         print("Install with: pip install youtube-dl whisper-openai")
+         return
+     
+     # Download videos
+     try:
+         download_playlist()
+     except Exception as e:
+         print(f"âŒ Download failed: {e}")
+     
+     # Transcribe videos
+     try:
+         transcribe_videos()
+     except Exception as e:
+         print(f"âŒ Transcription failed: {e}")
+     
+     # Create index
+     create_index()
+     
+     print("âœ… Laravel learning setup complete!")
+ 
+ if __name__ == "__main__":
+     main()
```

```diff
+ #!/usr/bin/env python3
+ """
+ Simple Laravel Video Downloader
+ Downloads videos and captions from the Laravel course playlist
+ """
+ 
+ import os
+ import json
+ from pathlib import Path
+ import subprocess
+ 
+ # Course playlist URL
+ PLAYLIST_URL = "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1NjOWtQ7S2o&list=PL3VM-unCzF8hy47mt9-chowaHNjfkuEVz"
+ OUTPUT_DIR = Path("./videos")
+ CAPTIONS_DIR = Path("./captions")
+ 
+ def setup_directories():
+     """Create necessary directories"""
+     OUTPUT_DIR.mkdir(exist_ok=True)
+     CAPTIONS_DIR.mkdir(exist_ok=True)
+     print(f"ğŸ“ Created directories: {OUTPUT_DIR} and {CAPTIONS_DIR}")
+ 
+ def download_with_captions():
+     """Download videos with captions using yt-dlp"""
+     
+     # First, let's get the playlist info
+     cmd = [
+         'yt-dlp',
+         '--extract-flat',
+         '--dump-json',
+         PLAYLIST_URL
+     ]
+     
+     try:
+         result = subprocess.run(cmd, capture_output=True, text=True, check=True)
+         playlist_info = []
+         for line in result.stdout.strip().split('\n'):
+             if line:
+                 playlist_info.append(json.loads(line))
+         
+         print(f"ğŸ“‹ Found {len(playlist_info)} videos in playlist")
+         
+         # Download each video with captions
+         for i, video in enumerate(playlist_info[:5]):  # Start with first 5 videos
+             video_id = video['id']
+             title = video['title']
+             
+             print(f"ğŸ¬ Downloading {i+1}/5: {title}")
+             
+             # Download video (720p max to save space)
+             download_cmd = [
+                 'yt-dlp',
+                 f'https://www.youtube.com/watch?v={video_id}',
+                 '-f', 'best[height<=720]',
+                 '-o', str(OUTPUT_DIR / f'{i+1:02d}-%(title)s.%(ext)s'),
+                 '--write-auto-subs',
+                 '--write-subs',
+                 '--sub-langs', 'en',
+                 '--sub-format', 'vtt',
+                 '--convert-subs', 'srt'
+             ]
+             
+             subprocess.run(download_cmd, check=True)
+             
+         print("âœ… Downloaded first 5 videos with captions!")
+         
+     except subprocess.CalledProcessError as e:
+         print(f"âŒ Error downloading: {e}")
+         print("Make sure yt-dlp is installed: pip install yt-dlp")
+     except FileNotFoundError:
+         print("âŒ yt-dlp not found. Install with: pip install yt-dlp")
+ 
+ def convert_captions_to_text():
+     """Convert SRT caption files to clean text"""
+     import re
+     
+     srt_files = list(OUTPUT_DIR.glob("*.srt"))
+     
+     for srt_file in srt_files:
+         # Read SRT file
+         with open(srt_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f:
+             content = f.read()
+         
+         # Remove SRT formatting (timestamps, numbers)
+         lines = content.split('\n')
+         text_lines = []
+         
+         for line in lines:
+             # Skip empty lines, numbers, and timestamp lines
+             if line.strip() and not line.strip().isdigit() and '-->' not in line:
+                 # Clean up the text
+                 clean_line = re.sub(r'<[^>]+>', '', line)  # Remove HTML tags
+                 if clean_line.strip():
+                     text_lines.append(clean_line.strip())
+         
+         # Save as clean text
+         video_name = srt_file.stem.replace('.en', '')
+         text_file = CAPTIONS_DIR / f"{video_name}.txt"
+         
+         with open(text_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f:
+             f.write(f"# {video_name}\n\n")
+             f.write('\n'.join(text_lines))
+         
+         print(f"âœ… Converted: {text_file}")
+ 
+ def create_learning_index():
+     """Create an index of all downloaded content"""
+     index = {
+         "course_title": "Laravel From Scratch",
+         "playlist_url": PLAYLIST_URL,
+         "videos": []
+     }
+     
+     # Index videos
+     video_files = sorted(OUTPUT_DIR.glob("*.mp4")) + sorted(OUTPUT_DIR.glob("*.webm"))
+     caption_files = sorted(CAPTIONS_DIR.glob("*.txt"))
+     
+     for video_file in video_files:
+         video_info = {
+             "filename": video_file.name,
+             "title": video_file.stem,
+             "size_mb": round(video_file.stat().st_size / (1024*1024), 1),
+             "has_captions": any(cap.stem.startswith(video_file.stem.split('.')[0]) for cap in caption_files)
+         }
+         index["videos"].append(video_info)
+
```

```diff
+ #!/usr/bin/env python3
+ """
+ Fixed Laravel Video Downloader
+ Downloads first 5 videos from Laravel course with captions
+ """
+ 
+ import os
+ import json
+ from pathlib import Path
+ import subprocess
+ 
+ # Course playlist URL  
+ PLAYLIST_URL = "https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL3VM-unCzF8hy47mt9-chowaHNjfkuEVz"
+ OUTPUT_DIR = Path("./videos")
+ CAPTIONS_DIR = Path("./captions")
+ 
+ def setup_directories():
+     """Create necessary directories"""
+     OUTPUT_DIR.mkdir(exist_ok=True)
+     CAPTIONS_DIR.mkdir(exist_ok=True)
+     print(f"ğŸ“ Created directories: {OUTPUT_DIR} and {CAPTIONS_DIR}")
+ 
+ def download_videos():
+     """Download first 5 videos with captions"""
+     
+     print("ğŸ¬ Downloading first 5 Laravel videos...")
+     
+     # Download command for first 5 videos
+     cmd = [
+         'yt-dlp',
+         PLAYLIST_URL,
+         '--playlist-end', '5',  # Only first 5 videos
+         '-f', 'best[height<=720]',  # 720p max
+         '-o', str(OUTPUT_DIR / '%(playlist_index)02d-%(title)s.%(ext)s'),
+         '--write-auto-subs',
+         '--write-subs', 
+         '--sub-langs', 'en',
+         '--convert-subs', 'srt',
+         '--embed-metadata'
+     ]
+     
+     try:
+         subprocess.run(cmd, check=True)
+         print("âœ… Downloaded videos successfully!")
+         return True
+     except subprocess.CalledProcessError as e:
+         print(f"âŒ Download failed: {e}")
+         return False
+     except FileNotFoundError:
+         print("âŒ yt-dlp not found. Install with: pip install yt-dlp")
+         return False
+ 
+ def process_captions():
+     """Convert SRT files to readable text"""
+     import re
+     
+     srt_files = list(OUTPUT_DIR.glob("*.srt"))
+     print(f"ğŸ“„ Processing {len(srt_files)} caption files...")
+     
+     for srt_file in srt_files:
+         try:
+             with open(srt_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f:
+                 content = f.read()
+         except UnicodeDecodeError:
+             # Try different encoding
+             with open(srt_file, 'r', encoding='latin-1') as f:
+                 content = f.read()
+         
+         # Clean SRT content
+         lines = []
+         for line in content.split('\n'):
+             line = line.strip()
+             # Skip timestamps and sequence numbers
+             if line and not line.isdigit() and '-->' not in line:
+                 # Remove HTML tags and clean up
+                 clean_line = re.sub(r'<[^>]+>', '', line)
+                 clean_line = re.sub(r'\[.*?\]', '', clean_line)  # Remove [Music], [Applause], etc.
+                 if clean_line.strip():
+                     lines.append(clean_line.strip())
+         
+         # Save cleaned text
+         video_name = srt_file.stem.replace('.en', '')
+         text_file = CAPTIONS_DIR / f"{video_name}.txt"
+         
+         with open(text_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f:
+             f.write(f"# Laravel Course - {video_name}\n\n")
+             f.write('\n'.join(lines))
+         
+         print(f"âœ… Processed: {text_file.name}")
+ 
+ def create_study_guide():
+     """Create a study guide from all videos"""
+     
+     caption_files = sorted(CAPTIONS_DIR.glob("*.txt"))
+     
+     study_guide = """# ğŸ”¹ Laravel From Scratch - Study Guide
+ 
+ ## Course Overview
+ - **Source**: Jeffrey Way (Laracasts)
+ - **Videos Downloaded**: {video_count}
+ - **Focus**: Laravel fundamentals for VehicleVault conversion
+ 
+ ## Video Breakdown
+ 
+ """.format(video_count=len(caption_files))
+     
+     for i, caption_file in enumerate(caption_files, 1):
+         # Read first few lines to get topic overview
+         with open(caption_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f:
+             content = f.read()
+             
+         # Extract first paragraph as summary
+         lines = content.split('\n')
+         summary_lines = []
+         for line in lines[2:]:  # Skip title and empty line
+             if line.strip():
+                 summary_lines.append(line.strip())
+                 if len(summary_lines) >= 3:  # First 3 sentences
+                     break
+         
+         summary = ' '.join(summary_lines)[:200] + "..." if len(' '.join(summary_lines)) > 200 else ' '.join(summary_lines)
+         
+         study_guide += f"""### Video {i}: {caption_file.stem}
+ **Summary**: {summary}
+ 
+ **Key Points** (to extract while watching):
+ - [ ] Main concept covered
+ - [ ] Code examples shown  
+ - [ ] Commands/artisan tools used
+ - [ ] How this applies to VehicleVault
+ 
+ ---
+ 
+ """
+     
+     # Save study guide
+     with open("Laravel-Study-Guide.md", 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f:
+         f.write(study_guide)
+     
+     print("ğŸ“š Created Laravel-Study-Guide.md")
+ 
+ def main():
+     print("ğŸš€ Laravel Learning Downloader v2.0")
+     print("ğŸ“¹ Downloading first 5 videos from Jeffrey Way's Laravel course...")
+     
+     setup_directories()
+     
+     # Download videos
+     if download_videos():
+         # Process captions
+         process_captions()
+         
+         # Create study guide
+         create_study_guide()
+         
+         print("\nâœ… All done! Here's what you got:")
+         print(f"ğŸ“ Videos: {len(list(OUTPUT_DIR.glob('*.mp4')))} files in {OUTPUT_DIR}/")
+         print(f"ğŸ“„ Captions: {len(list(CAPTIONS_DIR.glob('*.txt')))} files in {CAPTIONS_DIR}/")
+         print("ğŸ“š Study guide: Laravel-Study-Guide.md")
+         print("\nğŸ¯ Next steps:")
+         print("1. Watch video 1 while following Laravel-Study-Guide.md")
+         print("2. Set up your first Laravel project")
+         print("3. Start converting VehicleVault backend")
+     else:
+         print("âŒ Setup failed. Check your internet connection and try again.")
+ 
+ if __name__ == "__main__":
+     main()
```

```diff
+
```

```diff
+             self::STATUS_RESERVED,
+             self::STATUS_IN_TRANSIT,
+             self::STATUS_DISPLAY,
+         ];

+     {
+         return $this->belongsTo(Location::class);
+     }
+ 
+     // Scopes
+     public function scopeAvailable($query)
+     {
+         return $query->where('status', self::STATUS_AVAILABLE);
+     }
+ 
+     public function scopeByStatus($query, $status)
+     {
+         return $query->where('status', $status);
+     }
+ 
+     public function scopeByModel($query, $modelId)
+     {
+         return $query->where('model_id', $modelId);
+     }
+ 
+     // Accessors
+     public function getFullNameAttribute(): string
+     {
+         $parts = [
+             $this->model->brand->name ?? '',
+             $this->model->name ?? '',
+             $this->trim->name ?? '',
+             $this->color ?? '',
+         ];
+ 
+         return implode(' ', array_filter($parts));
+     }
+ 
+     public function getIsAvailableAttribute(): bool
+     {
+         return $this->status === self::STATUS_AVAILABLE;
+     }
+ }
```

```diff
+ use Illuminate\Http\JsonResponse;
+ use Illuminate\Validation\Rule;
+ 
+ class VehicleController extends Controller
+ {
+     /**
+      * Get all vehicles with relationships
+      */
+     public function index(Request $request): JsonResponse
+     {
+         $query = Vehicle::with(['model.brand', 'trim', 'location']);
+ 
+         // Filter by status
+         if ($request->has('status')) {
+             $query->byStatus($request->status);
+         }
+ 
+         // Filter by model
+         if ($request->has('model_id')) {
+             $query->byModel($request->model_id);
+         }
+ 
+         // Search functionality
+         if ($request->has('search')) {
+             $search = $request->search;
+             $query->whereHas('model', function ($q) use ($search) {
+                 $q->where('name', 'like', "%{$search}%")
+                   ->orWhereHas('brand', function ($brandQuery) use ($search) {
+                       $brandQuery->where('name', 'like', "%{$search}%");
+                   });
+             })->orWhere('vin', 'like', "%{$search}%")
+               ->orWhere('color', 'like', "%{$search}%");
+         }
+ 
+         $vehicles = $query->orderBy('created_at', 'desc')
+                          ->paginate($request->get('per_page', 15));
+ 
+         return response()->json($vehicles);
+     }
+ 
+     /**
+      * Store a new vehicle
+      */
+     public function store(Request $request): JsonResponse
+     {
+         $validated = $request->validate([
+             'model_id' => 'required|exists:models,id',
+             'trim_id' => 'nullable|exists:trims,id',
+             'location_id' => 'nullable|exists:locations,id',
+             'vin' => 'nullable|string|max:17|unique:vehicles,vin',
+             'color' => 'nullable|string|max:100',
+             'status' => ['required', Rule::in(Vehicle::getStatuses())],
+             'notes' => 'nullable|string',
+         ]);
+ 
+         $vehicle = Vehicle::create($validated);
+         $vehicle->load(['model.brand', 'trim', 'location']);
+ 
+         return response()->json([
+             'message' => 'Vehicle created successfully',
+             'vehicle' => $vehicle
+         ], 201);
+     }
+ 
+     /**
+      * Get a specific vehicle
+      */
+     public function show(Vehicle $vehicle): JsonResponse
+     {
+         $vehicle->load(['model.brand', 'trim', 'location']);
+         
+         return response()->json($vehicle);
+     }
+ 
+     /**
+      * Update a vehicle
+      */
+     public function update(Request $request, Vehicle $vehicle): JsonResponse
+     {
+         $validated = $request->validate([
+             'model_id' => 'sometimes|exists:models,id',
+             'trim_id' => 'nullable|exists:trims,id',
+             'location_id' => 'nullable|exists:locations,id',
+             'vin' => [
+                 'nullable',
+                 'string',
+                 'max:17',
+                 Rule::unique('vehicles', 'vin')->ignore($vehicle->id)
+             ],
+             'color' => 'nullable|string|max:100',
+             'status' => ['sometimes', Rule::in(Vehicle::getStatuses())],
+             'notes' => 'nullable|string',
+         ]);
+ 
+         $vehicle->update($validated);
+         $vehicle->load(['model.brand', 'trim', 'location']);
+ 
+         return response()->json([
+             'message' => 'Vehicle updated successfully',
+             'vehicle' => $vehicle
+         ]);
+     }
+ 
+     /**
+      * Delete a vehicle
+      */
+     public function destroy(Vehicle $vehicle): JsonResponse
+     {
+         $vehicle->delete();
+ 
+         return response()->json([
+             'message' => 'Vehicle deleted successfully'
+         ]);
+     }
+ 
+     /**
+      * Get vehicles by status
+      */
+     public function byStatus(string $status): JsonResponse
+     {
+         if (!in_array($status, Vehicle::getStatuses())) {
+             return response()->json(['error' => 'Invalid status'], 400);
+         }
+ 
+         $vehicles = Vehicle::with(['model.brand', 'trim', 'location'])
+                           ->byStatus($status)
+                           ->orderBy('created_at', 'desc')
+                           ->get();
+ 
+         return response()->json($vehicles);
+     }
+ 
+     /**
+      * Get vehicles by model
+      */
+     public function byModel(int $modelId): JsonResponse
+     {
+         $vehicles = Vehicle::with(['model.brand', 'trim', 'location'])
+                           ->byModel($modelId)
+                           ->orderBy('created_at', 'desc')
+                           ->get();
+ 
+         return response()->json($vehicles);
+     }
+ 
+     /**
+      * Bulk update vehicle statuses
+      */
+     public function bulkUpdateStatus(Request $request): JsonResponse
+     {
+         $validated = $request->validate([
+             'vehicle_ids' => 'required|array',
+             'vehicle_ids.*' => 'exists:vehicles,id',
+             'status' => ['required', Rule::in(Vehicle::getStatuses())],
+         ]);
+ 
+         $updated = Vehicle::whereIn('id', $validated['vehicle_ids'])
+                          ->update(['status' => $validated['status']]);
+ 
+         return response()->json([
+             'message' => "Updated {$updated} vehicles",
+             'updated_count' => $updated
+         ]);
+     }
+ 
+     /**
+      * Get dashboard statistics
+      */
+     public function stats(): JsonResponse
+     {
+         $stats = [
+             'total' => Vehicle::count(),
+             'available' => Vehicle::byStatus(Vehicle::STATUS_AVAILABLE)->count(),
+             'reserved' => Vehicle::byStatus(Vehicle::STATUS_RESERVED)->count(),
+             'in_transit' => Vehicle::byStatus(Vehicle::STATUS_IN_TRANSIT)->count(),
+             'display' => Vehicle::byStatus(Vehicle::STATUS_DISPLAY)->count(),
+             'by_brand' => Vehicle::with('model.brand')
+                                ->get()
+                                ->groupBy('model.brand.name')
+                                ->map->count(),
+         ];
+ 
+         return response()->json($stats);
+     }
+ }
```

Let's fix our migration to skip the users table since Laravel already created it:

```diff
      public function up(): void
      {
-         // Create users table (Laravel has this by default, but let's customize it)
-         Schema::create('users', function (Blueprint $table) {
-             $table->id();
-             $table->string('username')->unique();
-             $table->string('email')->unique()->nullable();
-             $table->timestamp('email_verified_at')->nullable();
-             $table->string('password');
-             $table->enum('role', ['admin', 'staff'])->default('staff');
-             $table->enum('status', ['pending', 'approved', 'rejected'])->default('pending');
-             $table->rememberToken();
-             $table->timestamps();
+         // Update the existing users table to add our custom fields
+         Schema::table('users', function (Blueprint $table) {
+             $table->string('username')->unique()->after('id');
+             $table->enum('role', ['admin', 'staff'])->default('staff')->after('password');
+             $table->enum('status', ['pending', 'approved', 'rejected'])->default('pending')->after('role');
          });
```

**Option 2: Convert to Laravel Only (One-Building Setup)**  
- **Laravel** = Restaurant with kitchen AND dining room in same building
- Everything happens in one place

```diff
+ // Detect environment
+ const isDevelopment = window.location.hostname === 'localhost' || window.location.hostname === '127.0.0.1';
+ 
+ // Export current config
+ export const currentConfig = isDevelopment ? API_CONFIG.development : API_CONFIG.production;
+ 
+ // Helper function to build API URLs
+ export const apiURL = (endpoint: string) => {
+   // Remove leading slash if present
+   const cleanEndpoint = endpoint.startsWith('/') ? endpoint.slice(1) : endpoint;
+   return `${currentConfig.apiURL}/${cleanEndpoint}`;

+ 
+ // Helper for auth endpoints (these go to base URL, not /api)
+ export const authURL = (endpoint: string) => {
+   const cleanEndpoint = endpoint.startsWith('/') ? endpoint.slice(1) : endpoint;
+   return `${currentConfig.baseURL}/${cleanEndpoint}`;
+ };
```

Ah, we're getting a CSRF error (Page Expired = 419). This is expected with Laravel. Let me create a simple solution for your React app to handle Laravel authentication properly.

First, let me create an auth helper for your React app:

---

```diff

+ import { apiURL, authURL } from '../config/api';
+ 
+ // Auth helper functions for Laravel Sanctum
+ export const auth = {
+   // Get CSRF token (required for Laravel)
+   async getCsrfToken(): Promise<void> {
+     try {
+       await fetch(authURL('sanctum/csrf-cookie'), {
+         credentials: 'include',
+       });
+     } catch (error) {
+       console.error('Error getting CSRF token:', error);
+     }
+   },
+ 
+   // Login with email and password
+   async login(email: string, password: string) {
+     // First get CSRF token
+     await this.getCsrfToken();
+     
+     const response = await fetch(authURL('login'), {
+       method: 'POST',
+       headers: {
+         'Content-Type': 'application/json',
+         'Accept': 'application/json',
+       },
+       credentials: 'include',
+       body: JSON.stringify({ email, password }),
+     });
```

```diff
- 
+ import React, { createContext, useContext, useState, useEffect } from 'react';
+ import { auth } from '../lib/auth';
+ 
+ interface User {
+   id: number;
+   name: string;
+   email: string;
+   username?: string;
+   created_at: string;
+ }
+ 
+ interface AuthContextType {
+   user: User | null;
+   loading: boolean;
+   login: (email: string, password: string) => Promise<void>;
+   register: (name: string, email: string, password: string, passwordConfirmation: string) => Promise<void>;
+   logout: () => Promise<void>;
+   isAuthenticated: boolean;
+ }
+ 
+ const AuthContext = createContext<AuthContextType | undefined>(undefined);
+ 
+ export function AuthProvider({ children }: { children: React.ReactNode }) {
+   const [user, setUser] = useState<User | null>(null);
+   const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true);
+ 
+   // Check if user is authenticated on mount
+   useEffect(() => {
+     checkAuth();
+   }, []);
+ 
+   const checkAuth = async () => {
+     try {
+       const userData = await auth.getUser();
+       setUser(userData);
+     } catch (error) {
+       console.log('Not authenticated');
+       setUser(null);
+     } finally {
+       setLoading(false);
+     }
+   };
+ 
+   const login = async (email: string, password: string) => {
+     try {
+       const response = await auth.login(email, password);
+       
+       // After successful login, get user data
+       const userData = await auth.getUser();
+       setUser(userData);
+     } catch (error) {
+       throw error; // Re-throw so components can handle the error
+     }
+   };
+ 
+   const register = async (name: string, email: string, password: string, passwordConfirmation: string) => {
+     try {
+       const response = await auth.register(name, email, password, passwordConfirmation);
+       
+       // After successful registration, get user data
+       const userData = await auth.getUser();
+       setUser(userData);
+     } catch (error) {
+       throw error;
+     }
+   };
+ 
+   const logout = async () => {
+     try {
+       await auth.logout();
+       setUser(null);
+     } catch (error) {
+       console.error('Logout error:', error);
+       // Even if logout fails on server, clear local state
+       setUser(null);
+     }
+   };
+ 
+   const value: AuthContextType = {
+     user,
+     loading,
+     login,
+     register,
+     logout,
+     isAuthenticated: !!user,
+   };
+ 
+   return (
+     <AuthContext.Provider value={value}>
+       {children}
+     </AuthContext.Provider>
+   );
+ }
+ 
+ export function useAuth() {
+   const context = useContext(AuthContext);
+   if (context === undefined) {
+     throw new Error('useAuth must be used within an AuthProvider');
+   }
+   return context;
+ }
+ 
+ // Helper components similar to Clerk's pattern
+ export function SignedIn({ children }: { children: React.ReactNode }) {
+   const { isAuthenticated, loading } = useAuth();
+   
+   if (loading) return null;
+   
+   return isAuthenticated ? <>{children}</> : null;
+ }
+ 
+ export function SignedOut({ children }: { children: React.ReactNode }) {
+   const { isAuthenticated, loading } = useAuth();
+   
+   if (loading) return null;
+   
+   return !isAuthenticated ? <>{children}</> : null;
+ }
+ 
+ export function RedirectToSignIn() {
+   // In a real app, you might use wouter's useLocation to redirect
+   // For now, we'll just redirect to the login page
+   React.useEffect(() => {
+     window.location.href = '/login';
+   }, []);
+   
+   return <div>Redirecting to login...</div>;
+ } 
```

```diff
  use App\Http\Controllers\Controller;
+ use App\Models\User;
  use Illuminate\Http\Request;
+ use Illuminate\Http\JsonResponse;
+ use Illuminate\Support\Facades\Auth;
+ use Illuminate\Support\Facades\Hash;
+ use Illuminate\Validation\ValidationException;
  
  class AuthController extends Controller
  {
+     /**
+      * Login user and return JSON response
+      */
+     public function login(Request $request): JsonResponse
+     {
+         $request->validate([
+             'email' => 'required|email',
+             'password' => 'required',
+         ]);
+ 
+         // Attempt to authenticate
+         if (!Auth::attempt($request->only('email', 'password'))) {
+             return response()->json([
+                 'message' => 'Invalid credentials'
+             ], 401);
+         }
+ 
+         $user = Auth::user();
+         
+         return response()->json([
+             'message' => 'Login successful',
+             'user' => $user
+         ]);
+     }
+ 
+     /**
+      * Register new user and return JSON response
+      */
+     public function register(Request $request): JsonResponse
+     {
+         $request->validate([
+             'name' => 'required|string|max:255',
+             'email' => 'required|string|email|max:255|unique:users',
+             'password' => 'required|string|min:8|confirmed',
+         ]);
+ 
+         // Generate a username from email if not provided
+         $username = explode('@', $request->email)[0];
+         
+         // Ensure username is unique
+         $originalUsername = $username;
+         $counter = 1;
+         while (User::where('username', $username)->exists()) {
+             $username = $originalUsername . $counter;
+             $counter++;
+         }
+ 
+         $user = User::create([
+             'name' => $request->name,
+             'username' => $username,
+             'email' => $request->email,
+             'password' => Hash::make($request->password),
+         ]);
+ 
+         // Log the user in
+         Auth::login($user);
+ 
+         return response()->json([
+             'message' => 'Registration successful',
+             'user' => $user
+         ], 201);
+     }
+ 
+     /**
+      * Logout user
+      */
+     public function logout(Request $request): JsonResponse
+     {
+         Auth::logout();
+ 
+         $request->session()->invalidate();
+         $request->session()->regenerateToken();
+ 
+         return response()->json([
+             'message' => 'Logout successful'
+         ]);
+     }
+ 
+     /**
+      * Get current authenticated user
+      */
+     public function user(Request $request): JsonResponse
+     {
+         return response()->json($request->user());
+     }
```

ğŸ”¹ **What I Fixed:**
- Added `validateCsrfTokens(except: ['api/*'])` to Laravel 11's middleware configuration  
- This exempts ALL `/api/*` routes from CSRF validation
- The EnsureFrontendRequestsAreStateful middleware was forcing CSRF checks

**Try the login now** - you should see success in the console logs! The 419 CSRF error should be gone. ğŸ¤–

```diff
+         'address',
+         'city',
+         'state',
+         'postal_code',
+         'country',
+         'capacity',
+         'description',
+         'is_active',
+     ];
+ 
+     protected $casts = [
+         'is_active' => 'boolean',
+         'capacity' => 'integer',
+     ];
+ 
+     // Relationships
+     public function vehicles(): HasMany
+     {
+         return $this->hasMany(Vehicle::class);
+     }
+ 
+     // Scopes
+     public function scopeActive($query)
+     {
+         return $query->where('is_active', true);
+     }
+ 
+     public function scopeByType($query, $type)
+     {
+         return $query->where('type', $type);
+     }
+ 
+     // Accessors
+     public function getFullAddressAttribute(): string
+     {
+         $parts = array_filter([
+             $this->address,
+             $this->city,
+             $this->state,
+             $this->postal_code,
+             $this->country
+         ]);
+         return implode(', ', $parts);
+     }
+ 
+     public function getCurrentCapacityAttribute(): int
+     {
+         return $this->vehicles()->count();
+     }
+ 
+     public function getAvailableSpaceAttribute(): ?int
+     {
+         return $this->capacity ? $this->capacity - $this->current_capacity : null;
+     }
+ 
+     public function getRouteKeyName(): string
+     {
+         return 'code';
+     }
  }
```

```diff
+
```

```diff
+ 
+ const buttonVariants = cva(
+   "inline-flex items-center justify-center whitespace-nowrap rounded-md text-sm font-medium ring-offset-background transition-colors focus-visible:outline-none focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-ring focus-visible:ring-offset-2 disabled:pointer-events-none disabled:opacity-50",
+   {
+     variants: {
+       variant: {
+         default: "bg-primary text-primary-foreground hover:bg-primary/90",
+         destructive:
+           "bg-destructive text-destructive-foreground hover:bg-destructive/90",
+         outline:
+           "border border-input bg-background hover:bg-accent hover:text-accent-foreground",
+         secondary:
+           "bg-secondary text-secondary-foreground hover:bg-secondary/80",
+         ghost: "hover:bg-accent hover:text-accent-foreground",
+         link: "text-primary underline-offset-4 hover:underline",
+       },
+       size: {
+         default: "h-10 px-4 py-2",
+         sm: "h-9 rounded-md px-3",
+         lg: "h-11 rounded-md px-8",
+         icon: "h-10 w-10",
+       },
+     },
+     defaultVariants: {
+       variant: "default",
+       size: "default",
+     },
+   }
+ )
+ 
+ export interface ButtonProps
+   extends React.ButtonHTMLAttributes<HTMLButtonElement>,
+     VariantProps<typeof buttonVariants> {
+   asChild?: boolean
+ }
+ 
+ const Button = React.forwardRef<HTMLButtonElement, ButtonProps>(
+   ({ className, variant, size, asChild = false, ...props }, ref) => {
+     const Comp = asChild ? Slot : "button"
+     return (
+       <Comp
+         className={cn(buttonVariants({ variant, size, className }))}
+         ref={ref}
+         {...props}
+       />
+     )
+   }
+ )
+ Button.displayName = "Button"
+ 
+ export { Button, buttonVariants }
```

Perfect! I found the issues! There are 2 main problems:

1. **Route [login] not defined** - The Auth middleware is looking for a named 'login' route 
2. **Call to undefined method App\Models\User::createToken()** - The User model doesn't have the Sanctum trait

Let me fix both issues:

---

```diff
- 
+ <?php
+ 
+ namespace App\Models;
+ 
+ // use Illuminate\Contracts\Auth\MustVerifyEmail;
+ use Illuminate\Database\Eloquent\Factories\HasFactory;
+ use Illuminate\Foundation\Auth\User as Authenticatable;
+ use Illuminate\Notifications\Notifiable;
+ use Laravel\Sanctum\HasApiTokens;
+ 
+ class User extends Authenticatable
+ {
+     /** @use HasFactory<\Database\Factories\UserFactory> */
+     use HasApiTokens, HasFactory, Notifiable;
+ 
+     /**
+      * The attributes that are mass assignable.
+      *
+      * @var array<int, string>
+      */
+     protected $fillable = [
+         'name',
+         'email',
+         'password',
+     ];
+ 
+     /**
+      * The attributes that should be hidden for serialization.
+      *
+      * @var array<int, string>
+      */
+     protected $hidden = [
+         'password',
+         'remember_token',
+     ];
+ 
+     /**
+      * Get the attributes that should be cast.
+      *
+      * @return array<string, string>
+      */
+     protected function casts(): array
+     {
+         return [
+             'email_verified_at' => 'datetime',
+             'password' => 'hashed',
+         ];
+     }
+ } 
```

---

Now let me add the login route name to fix the first issue:

---

```diff
- 
+ <?php
+ 
+ use Illuminate\Http\Request;
+ use Illuminate\Support\Facades\Route;
+ use App\Http\Controllers\Api\BrandController;
+ use App\Http\Controllers\Api\VehicleModelController;
+ use App\Http\Controllers\Api\VehicleController;
+ use App\Http\Controllers\Api\LocationController;
+ use App\Http\Controllers\Api\AuthController;
+ 
+ // Health check endpoint
+ Route::get('/health', function () {
+     return response()->json([
+         'status' => 'ok',
+         'message' => 'VehicleVault API is running',
+         'version' => '2.0.0',
+         'laravel' => app()->version(),
+         'timestamp' => now()->toISOString()
+     ]);
+ });
+ 
+ // Public API routes
+ Route::apiResource('brands', BrandController::class)->only(['index', 'show']);
+ Route::apiResource('vehicle-models', VehicleModelController::class)->only(['index', 'show']);
+ Route::apiResource('vehicles', VehicleController::class)->only(['index', 'show']);
+ Route::apiResource('locations', LocationController::class)->only(['index', 'show']);
+ 
+ // Authentication routes (public)
+ Route::post('/register', [AuthController::class, 'register'])->name('register');
+ Route::post('/login', [AuthController::class, 'login'])->name('login');
+ 
+ // Protected routes requiring authentication
+ Route::middleware('auth:sanctum')->group(function () {
+     // User info
+     Route::get('/user', function (Request $request) {
+         return response()->json([
+             'status' => 'success',
+             'data' => $request->user()
+         ]);
+     })->name('user');
+     
+     // Logout
+     Route::post('/logout', [AuthController::class, 'logout'])->name('logout');
+     
+     // Protected CRUD operations
+     Route::apiResource('brands', BrandController::class)->except(['index', 'show']);
+     Route::apiResource('vehicle-models', VehicleModelController::class)->except(['index', 'show']);
+     Route::apiResource('vehicles', VehicleController::class)->except(['index', 'show']);
+     Route::apiResource('locations', LocationController::class)->except(['index', 'show']);
+ });
```

I can see there's still a 500 error and HTML is being returned instead of JSON. Let me fix the issue by checking the authentication in your auth controller:

---

```diff
- 
+ <?php
+ 
+ namespace App\Http\Controllers\Api;
+ 
+ use App\Http\Controllers\Controller;
+ use App\Models\User;
+ use Illuminate\Http\Request;
+ use Illuminate\Support\Facades\Auth;
+ use Illuminate\Support\Facades\Hash;
+ use Illuminate\Support\Facades\Validator;
+ use Illuminate\Validation\ValidationException;
+ 
+ class AuthController extends Controller
+ {
+     /**
+      * Register a new user
+      */
+     public function register(Request $request)
+     {
+         $validator = Validator::make($request->all(), [
+             'name' => 'required|string|max:255',
+             'email' => 'required|string|email|max:255|unique:users',
+             'password' => 'required|string|min:8|confirmed',
+         ]);
+ 
+         if ($validator->fails()) {
+             return response()->json([
+                 'status' => 'error',
+                 'message' => 'Validation failed',
+                 'errors' => $validator->errors()
+             ], 422);
+         }
+ 
+         $user = User::create([
+             'name' => $request->name,
+             'email' => $request->email,
+             'password' => Hash::make($request->password),
+         ]);
+ 
+         $token = $user->createToken('auth_token')->plainTextToken;
+ 
+         return response()->json([
+             'status' => 'success',
+             'message' => 'User registered successfully',
+             'data' => [
+                 'user' => $user,
+                 'token' => $token,
+                 'token_type' => 'Bearer'
+             ]
+         ], 201);
+     }
+ 
+     /**
+      * Login user
+      */
+     public function login(Request $request)
+     {
+         // Check if username or email field is provided
+         $loginField = $request->has('email') ? 'email' : 'username';
+         $loginValue = $request->input($loginField);
+         
+         // If username is provided, treat it as email
+         if ($loginField === 'username') {
+             $loginValue = $request->input('username');
+             $loginField = 'email'; // Always use email for authentication
+         }
+ 
+         $validator = Validator::make([
+             'email' => $loginValue,
+             'password' => $request->password
+         ], [
+             'email' => 'required|email',
+             'password' => 'required|string',
+         ]);
+ 
+         if ($validator->fails()) {
+             return response()->json([
+                 'status' => 'error',
+                 'message' => 'Invalid credentials format',
+                 'errors' => $validator->errors()
+             ], 422);
+         }
+ 
+         if (!Auth::attempt(['email' => $loginValue, 'password' => $request->password])) {
+             return response()->json([
+                 'status' => 'error',
+                 'message' => 'Invalid credentials'
+             ], 401);
+         }
+ 
+         $user = Auth::user();
+         $token = $user->createToken('auth_token')->plainTextToken;
+ 
+         return response()->json([
+             'status' => 'success',
+             'message' => 'Login successful',
+             'data' => [
+                 'user' => $user,
+                 'token' => $token,
+                 'token_type' => 'Bearer'
+             ]
+         ]);
+     }
+ 
+     /**
+      * Logout user
+      */
+     public function logout(Request $request)
+     {
+         $request->user()->currentAccessToken()->delete();
+ 
+         return response()->json([
+             'status' => 'success',
+             'message' => 'Logged out successfully'
+         ]);
+     }
+ 
+     /**
+      * Get authenticated user
+      */
+     public function user(Request $request)
+     {
+         return response()->json([
+             'status' => 'success',
+             'data' => $request->user()
+         ]);
+     }
+ }
```
